io.grpc

Class LoadBalancer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.grpc.LoadBalancer<T>

  • @ExperimentalApi
 @ThreadSafe
public abstract class LoadBalancer<T>
extends Object
    A pluggable component that receives resolved addresses from NameResolver and provides the channel a usable transport when asked.

    Note to implementations: all methods are expected to return quickly. Any work that may block should be done asynchronously.

    • Method Detail

      • pickTransport

        public abstract ListenableFuture<T> pickTransport(@Nullable
                                                  RequestKey requestKey)
        Pick a transport that Channel will use for next RPC.

        If the caller gives up before the futrue is done, it should call either cancel(true) or cancel(false) (they have the same effect) on the future to avoid leaking of resources.

        Parameters:
        requestKey - for affinity-based routing

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down this LoadBalancer.

      • handleResolvedAddresses

        public void handleResolvedAddresses(List<ResolvedServerInfo> servers,
                                    Attributes config)
        Handles newly resolved addresses and service config from name resolution system.

        Implementations should not modify the given servers.

      • handleNameResolutionError

        public void handleNameResolutionError(Status error)
        Handles an error from the name resolution system.
        Parameters:
        error - a non-OK status

      • transportReady

        public void transportReady(EquivalentAddressGroup addressGroup,
                           T transport)
        Called when a transport is fully connected and ready to accept traffic.

      • transportShutdown

        public void transportShutdown(EquivalentAddressGroup addressGroup,
                              T transport,

        Called when a transport is shutting down.
